innhold.avsnitt: You may only apply for parental benefit when the child has been born.

To apply, log in using your BankID system from your bank or another approved electronic ID. The questions asked in the application are adapted to your situation, and instructions and information are provided as you fill in the form.

lesmer.intro: Har du fått sluttpakke, ventelønn eller vært i førstegangstjenesten?
lesmer.avsnitt: Du må legge ved dokumentasjon på inntekten og perioden hvis du har hatt en av disse inntektskildene:

lesmer.intro: Skal du ha foreldrepenger i fellesperioden?
lesmer.avsnitt: You must provide documentation of the mother’s activity requirement if you are staying at home during the shared period. She must either:

liste.punkt: combine studying with work that together makes it full-time
be fully dependent on assistance to take care of the child due to sickness
be hospitalised at a hospital or health care institution
participate full-time in the Introduction Programme for newly arrived immigrants pursuant to chapter 4 of the Introduction Act

lesmer.avsnitt: When mother works part-time, your parental benefits are reduced corresponding to mothers working hours. If the mothers working hours is 75 per cent or more, the mother is considered to have a full position. You can then receive up to 100 per cent parental benefit.

innhold.lesmer: If the mother is sick or hospitalised in a hospital or health care institution, you may apply for parental benefit before the child is born. In this case, you must send the application by post.
